com.stephengware.java.ai.planning.logic

Class NAryBooleanExpression

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.stephengware.java.ai.planning.logic.ExpressionObject
      • com.stephengware.java.ai.planning.logic.BooleanExpression
        • com.stephengware.java.ai.planning.logic.NAryBooleanExpression
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Expression, Formula, java.lang.Comparable<Formula>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Conjunction, Disjunction

    public abstract class NAryBooleanExpression
extends BooleanExpression
    The parent class of all Boolean expressions with an arbitrary number of arguments.
    Author:
    Stephen G. Ware

    • Field Summary

      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      ImmutableArray<Expression> arguments

      protected Bindings unifyArguments(NAryBooleanExpression other, Bindings bindings)
      Given another N-ary Boolean expression, this method unifies each of this expression's arguments with the corresponding argument in the other expression and returns the resulting bindings.

      • substituteArguments

        protected ImmutableArray<Expression> substituteArguments(Substitution substitution)
        Returns copies of the expression's arguments, but with terms replaced according to some substitution.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the arguments with variables replaced

      • unifyArguments

        protected Bindings unifyArguments(NAryBooleanExpression other,
                                  Bindings bindings)
        Given another N-ary Boolean expression, this method unifies each of this expression's arguments with the corresponding argument in the other expression and returns the resulting bindings.
        Parameters:
        other - the other expression with which to unify
        bindings - the set of bindings to which constraints will be added
        Returns:
        the new bindings (or null if the arguments cannot be unified)

      • negateArguments

        protected ImmutableArray<Expression> negateArguments()
        Returns copies of the expression's arguments, but negated.
        Returns:
        the negated arguments

      • flatten

        protected Expression[] flatten()
        If any of the arguments to this expression are expressions of the same type, their arguments are combined with this expression's arguments and the original expression is removed.
        Returns:
        the arguments of the flattened expression
